derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : formed irregularly from archaic bedrid 'bedridden person', from the base of the verb ride

entry.def: Someone who is bedridden is so ill or disabled that they cannot get out of bed.

example.ex: He had to spend two years bedridden with an injury.
example.tran: 他因伤不得不卧床两年。

auth_sentence.content: She gave up her housecleaning work and eventually became bedridden.
auth_sentence.res_content: She gave up her housecleaning work and eventually became bedridden.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She gave up her housecleaning work and eventually became bedridden.

auth_sentence.content: His father, almost blind, was bedridden.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His father, almost blind, was bedridden.

auth_sentence.content: Others I have known have not been so lucky and remain relatively bedridden.
